basics.name: Ziran Liu
basics.label: Postdoctoral Researcher
basics.summary: Researcher specializing in Probability Theory, Stochastic Processes, and Differential Geometry, with applications to Operations Research, AI, and Machine Learning.

work.name: Fudan University
work.summary: Research Institute of Intelligent Complex Systems. Conducting research on complex systems and stochastic processes, with applications to optimization and intelligent systems.
highlights: Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams on mathematical models for system analysis.

work.name: SIMIS (Shanghai Institute for Mathematics and Interdisciplinary Sciences)
work.summary: Leading research initiatives on mathematical modeling, queueing theory, and stochastic analysis.
highlights: Developing solutions to large-scale optimization problems for interdisciplinary projects.

work.name: UC Berkeley, Department of Statistics
work.summary: Undergraduate courses on probability theory, including stochastic processes, Markov chains, CLT, and Poisson processes.
highlights: Developed teaching materials to strengthen conceptual understanding of random variables.

work.name: Cardinal Operations
work.summary: Conducted research on stochastic processes, reflected Brownian motion, and queueing theory applications.
highlights: Collaborated with data science and engineering teams to implement optimization strategies.

work.name: NYU Stern School of Business
work.summary: Designed and taught undergraduate courses on operations research, focusing on optimization, scheduling, and queueing theory.
